serverChat

Class ServerSide.server

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • serverChat.ServerSide.server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    ServerSide

    public class ServerSide.server
extends java.lang.Thread
    Since:
    2017-11-19
    Version:
    1.0 This is the server class which defines how the communication takes place between the teacher and the student by establishing the port number and creating the LinkedLists of the clients and creating the buffer for the storage for the communication chat taken place between the student and the teacher.
    Author:
    Kashish

      void acceptNewConnection()
      acceptNewConnection is a method which accepts and establishes the connection between the server and the client.

    • Method Detail

      • InitServer

        public void InitServer()
        The InitServer opens the connection and looks that there is no blocking in the path between the client and the server. It takes the IP address of the localHost so that the connection can be established properly.

      • run

        public void run()
        It accepts the new connection which is requested by the clients as it calls the InitServer, calls the Init method. calls the acceptNewConnection method
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • acceptNewConnection

        public void acceptNewConnection()
        acceptNewConnection is a method which accepts and establishes the connection between the server and the client. Sends the welcome message to the client side.

      • addClient

        public void addClient(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel newClient)
        addClient functions add clients , looks that there is no blocking between the client as well as server. registers the client

        newClient -
